sub_title: Fighting for more equal opportunities in (Dutch) Education with Linguistic knowledge
summary:
(Socio)linguist specialised in creative multilingual practices and multilingualism in education (Research Masters of Linguistics and Communications at the University of Amsterdam).

Currently a part of Stichting Taal naar Keuze, a foundation in Amsterdam that aims to diversify language education in Dutch primary and secondary schools. By offering language education to (near-)native speakers of ANY language, we reaffirm what we already know: that language knowledge and multilingualism are a strength and not a disadvantage. And by making sure they complete final examinations in these languages we empower these students and increase their chances of academic success. 

Next to working for more equal opportunities in Dutch Education, I own a photography business based in Amsterdam: https://www.vogue.com/photovogue/photographers/274158. The Essence Collective allows me to co-create with other artists and capture stories of people and places that make this world special.

education.field_of_study: Linguistics with a Minor in International Development

awards.description:
Represented East Timor in the first Leadership camp in Singapore. Together with students from all ASEAN ( Association of Southeast Asian Nations) nations, participated in a one-week leadership camp. All mentors, activities and guest speakers highlighted the importance of goal-setting, collaboration, networking, and other key concepts.

projects.title: BA1 Linguistics Research Project - What are the attitudes and language preferences of multilinguals when swearing?
projects.description:
A sociolinguistic study focused on the language preference and attitude towards swearing of the multilingual communities of practice that are the United World Colleges. The study investigated cultural differences in the attitude towards swearing and the occurrence of phenomena such as code-switching as well as code-crossing as a result of language preference. Additionally, it examined the possible influence of language trends on campus on the occurrence of intraspeaker code-crossing.

The project was conducted as a part of the first year of the Bachelor of Linguistics at the University of Amsterdam.

projects.title: Het Nederlands en de andere talen: samen op school
projects.description:
Het Nederlands en de andere talen: samen op school is een informatieve film van een half uur, met deze webpagina erbij. Het programma is gemaakt voor schoolteams in het basisonderwijs en het voortgezet onderwijs.

Je vindt hier handvatten en ideeën over het omgaan met de taaldiversiteit op jouw school, over het inzetten van alle talenkennis die aanwezig is in jouw klas. Luister en kijk naar experts en naar jongeren die vertellen over taal, over hun eigen talen en de talen op school.

contributors.headline: Fighting for more equal opportunities in (Dutch) Education with Linguistic knowledge

projects.title: Multilingualismo iha Timor-Leste nia Social Media: The analysis of Linguistic Practices of young Timorese adults on Social Media Platforms from a Polylingualism perspective
projects.description: Timor-Leste, a country with an incredibly rich linguistic ecology, is the perfect case study for young underdeveloped countries’ relationship to globalisation. In countries where a long struggle for independence has led to the creation of environments with a rich linguistic ecology, their speakers are often faced with the issue of “language preference”. Are there languages used for specific purposes? How do speakers make these choices? These questions are all made under the traditional assumption that languages are bound systems. However, a newfound sociolinguistic understanding of language regards individual languages as social constructions. Furthermore, it views language, as a whole, as an abstract tool composed of a set linguistic features. This paper utilises this theory, Polylingualism, as a tool to analyse real-life language use on Social Media Platforms. In combination with a traditional approach to language, this paper researched (1) which linguistic features were present on young Timorese Social Media Platforms, (2) what goals were these languages used for, and lastly (3) what social meanings were attached to said languages. The results of this paper showed that young Timorese speakers are mainly using linguistic features from Tetum, Portuguese, English, and Indonesian, in addition to the non-standard variants of these languages. Moreover, in addition to the default goal of communication, these speakers use these languages for the purpose of identity construction and the improvement of their linguistic skills. Lastly, participants were able to attach social meanings to each of these languages, which shone light on some underlying ideologies held by the participants.

courses.name: History and Philosophy of the Humanities

profile_positions.description:
Stichting Taal Naar Keuze supports schools in making their language education and policy more inclusive and diverse. My role consists of the following tasks and co-working in the following projects: 
- Policy research and reporting
- Communication: copy-writing and editing, website creation and development, workshop materials, newsletters, content creation
- Language Inventories: development, execution, and analysis. A survey that analyses the language diversity of school communities (students, guardians, and staff), language education wishes, and ideas about the modernisation of education.
- Final examination programme: set up and organisation of online education & Taal naar Keuze's own secured online system, PTA's, external communication with supporting staff, partner schools, and students
profile_positions.title: (Socio)Linguist

profile_positions.description: Founder of photography company The Essence Collective (legally: The Essence Studio). Together with my clients creating unique images that reflect their story. Inspired by emotions and movement.

company.name: Hogeschool van Amsterdam | Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: As a Learning Assistant, my role consists of helping students with their academic English skills, as well other general study skills: organisation of workshops, private helping sessions, as well as, co-development of materials for Supplemental Instruction.
profile_positions.title: Learning Assistant

profile_positions.description: Teaching Academic Skills to first-year students enrolled in the Linguistics Bachelor Program. Content includes rhetoric and persuasiveness, structure techniques, literature review, and so on.
profile_positions.title: Academic Writing Teacher
Content Writer and Editor at KAT-blad - UvA's Linguistics Blog/Magazine
Social Media Coordinator at KAT-Blad - UvA's Linguistics Blog/Magazine

profile_positions.description:
This student-taught-initiative entails the assistance of the development of materials to be taught in the Academic Skills component of the Linguistics BA. 
Working alongside lecturers and a fellow student, my role consists of the creation of rubrics, lesson plans, and materials (power points, handouts, and external resources), serving as a bridge between students and lecturers.
profile_positions.title: Curriculum Developer
Activity and Fundraising Committee at KAT-Blad - UvA's Linguistics Blog/Magazine

profile_positions.description:
Together with two other group members, we are responsible for creating activities, both educational, social, and entertaining that are aimed at 
      1) integrating international students in the country and its culture
      2) integrating new students into the university and the community
      3) helping and motivating students in their studies
      4) sparking and feeding their passion for the field

Our most popular activity is the weekly borrels (get-togethers), with the occasional thematic borrels. These themes range from cultural events to linguistically related topics.

Some of our past events include:
    - Lectures on Linguistics (e.g. Esperanto, Poetry in Sign Language)
    - Linguistics related movie nights (e.g. "Arrival")
    - Study Trips (e.g. Estonia)
    - Parties (e.g. Halloween, Christmas Gala)
    - Career days in collaboration with other universities and student associations
    - And much more.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Activity Committee of the Linguistics Student Association

profile_positions.description: We are a group of four students responsible for advertising the activities planned by the Student Association. In other words, we derail our students from their main "priorities" for an hour or two, for the sake of procrastination.
profile_positions.title: Member of the Promotional Committee of the Linguistics Student Association

profile_positions.description:
Project MIND and its research is commissioned and funded by the Dutch Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment. The aim is to "investigate the effects of bilingual daycare on children's Dutch an English language development."

My responsibilities include administering language tests on children aged between two and four years old; contacting, coordinating, and scheduling testing days with two different daycares in Amsterdam and Eindhoven; and collecting and processing all data that has resulted from testing.
profile_positions.title: Testing Assistant

profile_positions.description: Freelance transcriptions and translation of videos from Portuguese to English and vice-versa.

profile_positions.description:
Timor Leste Youth for Peace is a non-profit organisation which aims at bringing the Timorese youth together for a better future. 
We do this through the creation of platforms and events that engage the young generations and spread the values of peace, sustainability, and global awareness.
profile_positions.title: Volunteer

profile_positions.description: Teacher responsible for the New Territories division in Hong Kong. Taught English, Maths, Dance, and Arts.
profile_positions.title: Teacher

volunteer_experiences.description: Representing Timor Leste Youth For Peace, and together with Timor-Leste's National Olympic Organisation, helped organize a three-day event, which included a marathon for Peace.
Official translator (English to Portuguese) for the SRI CHINMOY MARATHON TEAM at the 12 November National celebration in Dili, East Timor.

Co-organized sport events that aimed at bringing the youth in Timor-Leste together. In addition, Sports Impact has supported Timor-Leste Youth for Peace in the organization of the "Peace Day" event, held annually on the 21st of September.

The first Dili Model United Nations was held in Dili in the Summer of 2015. The initiative came from members of the organization Timor Leste Youth for Peace and United World College students. The conference is since then held annually and is funded by the US Embassy in Timor Leste. We have received a great support from quite important members of the community such as Mr. José Ramos Horta, Nobel Peace Prize laureate.
Acted as a bridge between Li Po Chun United World College/the students and the organization.
Organized an English boot camp for students in the Hospitality department.

Promotional work in the region of North Holland, the Netherlands.
Organize networking events for the alumni in the region.

The first Dili Model United Nations was held in Dili in the Summer of 2015. The initiative came from members of the organization Timor Leste Youth for Peace and United World College students. The conference is since then held annually and is funded by the US Embassy in Timor Leste.
